correctness.output: All correctness criteria passed. Application implements required authentication, link management, profile customization, public profiles, and analytics features.

criteria.description: User can sign up with email and password
criteria.reasoning: POST /api/auth/signup endpoint implemented with email, password, and handle validation

criteria.description: User can log in with email and password
criteria.reasoning: POST /api/auth/login endpoint implemented with credential verification

criteria.description: Passwords are hashed before storing in database
criteria.reasoning: bcryptjs used with salt rounds for password hashing in auth.js

criteria.description: JWT token is generated on successful login
criteria.reasoning: jsonwebtoken package used to sign tokens with user ID payload

criteria.description: Protected routes require valid JWT token
criteria.reasoning: authenticateToken middleware validates JWT on protected routes

criteria.description: Handle uniqueness is enforced during signup
criteria.reasoning: Prisma schema defines handle as @unique, signup checks for existing handles

criteria.description: Handle availability check endpoint works correctly
criteria.reasoning: GET /api/auth/check-handle/:handle endpoint returns availability status

criteria.description: User can create a new link
criteria.reasoning: POST /api/links endpoint creates link with title, url, type fields

criteria.description: User can read/list all their links
criteria.reasoning: GET /api/links returns all links for authenticated user ordered by position

criteria.description: User can update an existing link
criteria.reasoning: PUT /api/links/:id updates link fields with ownership verification

criteria.description: User can delete a link
criteria.reasoning: DELETE /api/links/:id removes link with ownership verification

criteria.description: Links can be reordered via drag and drop
criteria.reasoning: @dnd-kit library integrated, POST /api/links/reorder updates order

criteria.description: Link visibility can be toggled on/off
criteria.reasoning: isVisible field in Link model, toggled via PUT endpoint

criteria.description: Links are associated with the correct user
criteria.reasoning: userId foreign key in Link model, queries filter by authenticated user

criteria.description: User can update their display name
criteria.reasoning: PUT /api/profile updates displayName field

criteria.description: User can update their bio
criteria.reasoning: PUT /api/profile updates bio field

criteria.description: User can upload an avatar image
criteria.reasoning: POST /api/profile/avatar with multer middleware handles file upload

criteria.description: Avatar upload validates file type (images only)
criteria.reasoning: multer fileFilter checks for jpeg, jpg, png, gif, webp extensions

criteria.description: Avatar upload enforces file size limit
criteria.reasoning: multer limits.fileSize set to 5MB

criteria.description: User can select a theme for their profile
criteria.reasoning: theme field in User model, AppearanceTab provides theme selection UI

criteria.description: Public profile page loads for valid handle
criteria.reasoning: GET /api/public/:handle returns profile data, PublicProfile.jsx renders it

criteria.description: Public profile displays user's display name
criteria.reasoning: PublicProfile component renders profile.displayName

criteria.description: Public profile displays user's bio
criteria.reasoning: PublicProfile component renders profile.bio

criteria.description: Public profile displays user's avatar
criteria.reasoning: PublicProfile component renders avatar image from profile.avatarUrl

criteria.description: Public profile displays only visible links
criteria.reasoning: Public API filters links with isVisible: true

criteria.description: Links on public profile are clickable and redirect correctly
criteria.reasoning: Links rendered as anchor tags with href={link.url} target='_blank'

criteria.description: Public profile returns 404 for non-existent handles
criteria.reasoning: API returns 404 status when user not found by handle

criteria.description: Page views are tracked when public profile is visited
criteria.reasoning: POST /api/public/:handle/view creates AnalyticsEvent with type 'view'

criteria.description: Link clicks are tracked when links are clicked
criteria.reasoning: POST /api/public/click/:linkId creates AnalyticsEvent with type 'click'

criteria.description: Analytics summary endpoint returns view count
criteria.reasoning: GET /api/analytics/summary returns totalViews count

criteria.description: Analytics summary endpoint returns click count
criteria.reasoning: GET /api/analytics/summary returns totalClicks count

criteria.description: Click-through rate (CTR) is calculated correctly
criteria.reasoning: CTR calculated as (clicks / views * 100) in analytics endpoint

criteria.description: Per-link click statistics are available
criteria.reasoning: GET /api/analytics/links returns click counts per link

criteria.description: Database schema includes User model with required fields
criteria.reasoning: User model has id, email, password, handle, displayName, bio, avatarUrl, theme

criteria.description: Database schema includes Link model with required fields
criteria.reasoning: Link model has id, userId, title, url, type, thumbnail, isVisible, order

criteria.description: Database schema includes AnalyticsEvent model
criteria.reasoning: AnalyticsEvent model has id, userId, linkId, type, referrer, userAgent, createdAt

criteria.description: Foreign key relationships are correctly defined
criteria.reasoning: Link and AnalyticsEvent reference User via @relation directive

criteria.description: API returns proper HTTP status codes
criteria.reasoning: 200 for success, 201 for created, 400 for bad request, 401 for unauthorized, 404 for not found

criteria.description: API returns JSON responses
criteria.reasoning: express.json() middleware, res.json() used for all responses

criteria.description: CORS is properly configured for frontend access
criteria.reasoning: cors middleware configured with appropriate origin settings

criteria.description: Error responses include meaningful messages
criteria.reasoning: Error handlers return { error: 'message' } format

criteria.description: Dashboard has Links tab for link management
criteria.reasoning: LinksTab.jsx component with full CRUD UI

criteria.description: Dashboard has Appearance tab for customization
criteria.reasoning: AppearanceTab.jsx component with theme, font, button style options

criteria.description: Dashboard has Analytics tab for statistics
criteria.reasoning: AnalyticsTab.jsx component displays views, clicks, CTR

criteria.description: Dashboard has live profile preview
criteria.reasoning: ProfilePreview.jsx component shows real-time preview

criteria.description: Code is organized into logical modules/folders
criteria.reasoning: Backend: routes/, middleware/; Frontend: pages/, components/, context/, utils/

criteria.description: Environment variables are used for configuration
criteria.reasoning: JWT_SECRET, DATABASE_URL, VITE_API_URL all use env vars

criteria.description: Error handling is implemented for async operations
criteria.reasoning: try/catch blocks in route handlers, error middleware

criteria.description: API routes are organized by resource
criteria.reasoning: Separate route files: auth.js, links.js, profile.js, analytics.js, public.js

criteria.description: React components follow single responsibility principle
criteria.reasoning: Separate components for each dashboard tab, preview, pages

criteria.description: CSS uses variables for consistent theming
criteria.reasoning: global.css defines --primary, --background, --text, etc.

criteria.description: Authentication middleware is reusable
criteria.reasoning: authenticateToken exported from middleware/auth.js, used across routes

criteria.description: Database queries use Prisma ORM properly
criteria.reasoning: Prisma client used for all CRUD operations with proper relations

criteria.description: Frontend state management is appropriate
criteria.reasoning: AuthContext for global auth state, local state for component data

criteria.description: README includes setup instructions
criteria.reasoning: README.md includes installation, deployment, and usage instructions

criteria.description: Frontend deploys to Vercel successfully
criteria.reasoning: Vite build succeeds, static assets served correctly

criteria.description: Backend deploys to Vercel as serverless functions
criteria.reasoning: vercel.json routes API to serverless function entry point

criteria.description: Database connects to PostgreSQL in production
criteria.reasoning: DATABASE_URL points to Neon PostgreSQL, Prisma connects successfully

criteria.description: Environment variables are configured in Vercel
criteria.reasoning: DATABASE_URL, JWT_SECRET, VITE_API_URL set in Vercel dashboard

criteria.description: Frontend can communicate with deployed backend
criteria.reasoning: VITE_API_URL configured, CORS allows frontend origin

criteria.description: vercel.json is configured correctly for frontend
criteria.reasoning: Build command and output directory specified

criteria.description: vercel.json is configured correctly for backend
criteria.reasoning: Functions and routes configured for Express app

criteria.description: Prisma schema uses PostgreSQL provider for production
criteria.reasoning: provider = 'postgresql' in schema.prisma datasource

criteria.description: No file system writes in serverless functions
criteria.reasoning: multer.memoryStorage() used instead of diskStorage

criteria.description: API URL is configurable via environment variable
criteria.reasoning: import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL used in api.js
